ComparatorEqualInt1

This component is used to compare two integer values and trigger different output events dependent on whether one value is equal to the other.

If the data input [In]B is equal to [In]A then the boolean data output is set to "TRUE" and the output event [Out]t is triggered. Else the boolean data output is set to "FALSE" and the output event [Out]f is triggered.

If there is no input connected to [In]B value specified by the parameter Constant is compared to the the data input [In]A.

Ports

  • [In] :

    Data input, value to be compared.

  • [In] :

    Data input, value to be compared.

  • [Out] :

    Data output, is "TRUE" if [In]B is equal to [In]A, else is "FALSE".

  • [In] :

    Event input, triggers the comparison of the data input values.

  • [Out] t:

    Event output, triggered if [In]B is equal to [In]A.

  • [Out] f:

    Event output, triggered if [In]B is not equal to [In]A.

Parameters

  • Constant:

    Specifies value to be compared to the value of [In]A if no input is connected to [In]B.

    Data Type:

    I,

    Min Value:

    -2147483648,

    Max Value:

    2147483647,

    Default Value:

    0

State Machine

Stateless.

Profiles

All.

Toolbox

Core.

Version

v2.1.

Native Dependencies

  • TDK1.1:

Licence Type

LGPL.

Component Supplier

inx ltd.
